FLOCK: a group of animals herded together
COILED: wound into a series of rings
REPEL: to push away something with a similar magnetic field
AXIS: an imaginary line about which an object rotates
ILLUSION: something that is likely to be wrongly interpreted by the senses
EXPOSING: allowing to be subjected to an action, influence, or condition
CHARGED: having a positive or negative electric charge
ASTRONOMY: the study of the universe outside  Earth's atmosphere
POLE: one of two opposite points on a magnet at which magnetic forces are strongest
UNINHABITABLE: not able to have people or animals living within
